definition: to move the capital (city)
to move/to shift/to change (a position or location etc)/to promote
all/both/entirely/(used for emphasis) even/already/(not) at all
capital city/metropolis
surname Du

sentences.english: Is it time to move the capital now?
sentences.chinese: 現在到了遷都的時候了嗎？

sentences.english: Geographic environment has an importancent effect on the capital moving of Bohai regime.
sentences.chinese: 地理環境對渤海政權遷都產生了重要的作用。

sentences.english: It has been a protrudent phenomenon for the enterprise to move the capital to another place in Chinese economy recently.
sentences.chinese: 企業“遷都”是近年來中國經濟一個突出現象。

sentences.english: Datong is the capital of Beiwei Dynasty. And Xiaowendi Emperor move the capital to Luoyang.
sentences.chinese: 大同，是北魏的都城，到孝文帝時才遷都洛陽。

sentences.english: The devastation was so complete, the loss so profound, that Japan considered moving the capital.
sentences.chinese: 如此完整的破壞，損失如此深刻，即日本認爲遷都。

definition: to present tribute (to the emperor)
Prince Shōtoku Taiji (574-621), major Japanese statesman and reformer of the Asuka period 飛鳥時代|飞鸟时代[Fei1 niao3 Shi2 dai4], proponent of state Buddhism, portrayed as Buddhist saint
to be plagued with misfortunes/precarious
Manchukuo
TOYOTOMI Hideyoshi (1536-1598), Japanese warlord, undisputed ruler of Japan 1590-1598

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
to surrender and pay allegiance to
citadel/defensive city/acropolis
to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
Liu Yuan, warlord at the end of the Western Jin dynasty 西晋, founder of Cheng Han of the Sixteen Kingdoms 成漢|成汉 (304-347)
to die of old age/to live to a ripe old age/(fig.) (of sth) to come to an end (after a long period of service)
Tang and Song dynasty provincial governor, in Tang times having military and civil authority, but only civil authority in Song
to retreat in defeat
return of the emperor
to suppress by armed force/to send a punitive expedition against/to crusade against
Haojing (in modern Shaanxi, northwest of Chang'an county), capital of Western Zhou from c. 1050 BC
